comment: I really enjoyed his class. He had some medical issues during the semester but was very accommodating. Very discussion based and its always interesting. People in my class brought their friends sometimes just because it was such a great discussion based class.

He tells you to read the readings and that he will go over them in class, but he never did. He would just talk about his personal life and his time at UGA. The only grades are 3 thought papers, a midterm and a final exam and he never put in a single grade not even at the end of the semester. Midterm & final were super challenging and almost unfair

He is a very funny guy, but gets too much into politics and repeats his jokes... A LOT. He doesn't get grades back until finals, but if you do the readings and look into them yourself you'll be fine. He is basically just there to grade not help.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--So many papers

comment: I do not respect him as a college professor. He spends many class days talking about "the good ole days" at UGA and his frat brothers rather than the material. He goes over class time OFTEN. The class is VERY reading heavy so I studied hard and thought I did great on the exam... I got a low B. He tries... I guess, but honestly not worth the work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Taught the class with a broken leg, needed surgery but postponed it until after the semester ... who does that?? You could tell he was in pain, but soldiered on. Wendells lectures were amazing, never a dull moment! Always had time to talk his students. I wish I could take him again! Hes a UGA grad, GaState grad, Emory grad, Georgetown, Yale, etc.

Wendell is absolutely wonderful. He is so funny, engaging, and intelligent. There are three thought papers throughout the semester that are all opinion based. Read all of his readings he assigns or be like me and don't until the night before the exam (I got a 100). The class is always 10/10 entertaining and thought provoking. Enjoyed it thoroughly.

Professor Wendell is the best Professor Ive had at KSU! Every class he explains the readings that makes sense, and why it matters today. He always had time to sit and talk with me (or anyone) after class. Most profs make you schedule an appointment, but he takes the time any day. Such a awesome class. I learned so much had fun too, grew! Great!

I thought I knew a lot about religion, especially my own, but after the class I realize just how little I did know. Professor McMurrain really opened my eyes to the power & influence religion has on humanity. And when one religion dies, theres always another takes its place. Its a human thing, we need something outsides, beyond us. Hes the best!

He's a great professor with a great sense of humor. His class isn't a ton of work, but you are expected to read before class. Readings are super easy & most of the time pretty interesting. There's three essays which are super easy & two tests. If you show up to class & work to understand the texts, you'll be fine.

Wendell is a great professor. No textbook, but you absolutely have to do the readings (1-2 per class). He does take attendance, but rarely. Participate and you will do better- ask questions! I learned a lot from the readings and from taking the time to think about what I believe, too. This class will make you think, but you will learn so much!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Wendell is a cool guy. This class was ALL readings, so if you don't like doing 2 long readings a week then don't take it. 3 easy papers and 2 tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Best class. best teacher EVER! Professor McMurrain was awesome.

Professor McMurrain is one of the best teachers Ive ever had. Those negative reviews must have it twisted? We were assigned readings to read before class, which he posts (no $$ textbook), then wed discuss the readings in each class. Hed go behind the text as he called it, giving insight to who, where & when. Amazing teacher, wonderful man!

Awful Professor. He is late to every class and he keeps you 10 minutes over which is bad when you have class 15 minutes after. Only a midterm and a final and 3 papers. You will NEVER know your grade because he doesnt give anything back or Post in d2l. Mumbles constantly. Give lots of details on midterm/final.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's a really nice guy but he goes off topic a lot. Readings are usually 10-20 pages and you have to read them before class. 3 papers and 2 tests and he takes attendance sometimes. Most made Cs or lower on the midterm that he took a month to grade. He's usually late to class as well. If you put in work you can easily make a B, barely any made an A
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Just finished my final exam, its sad that the semester is over, no more Professor McMurrian. The class was easily my most favoRite of the semester, and probably the best class I took at KSU. He made the class so enjoyable, even though religion is such a dividing topic. I now know it is ok to question my religion. Very considerate to others

Hands down the best professor I have ever had. Super hilarious and lectures are very entertaining. He enjoys his job which can be hard to find these days. Two non-cumulative tests and a few "thought papers." The papers are easy A's as long as you turn them in. I would recommend this professor to anyone for sure. TAKE HIM you will not regret it.

Wendell is a fun teacher. He challenges students on their views though, so if you can't handle questioning your beliefs then don't take the course. That being said, back up your statements with logic and be willing to argue for what you believe and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: Professor McMurrain is amazing! His lectures are entertaining and he knows his stuff. There are readings in his class of mostly articles he post on d2l. There are 3 small thought papers, a mid-term based on the first half of the semester readings and final on the second half. This is an easy A if you read the articles and take notes in class.

great professor! gives about three papers for the semester along with a mid term and final. there is quite a bit of reading but he does talk about it during class and gives extra credit options. the tests are essay questions but if you prepare yourself and read the content you will enjoy the class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Best class I've ever had, learned so much about religion, the world, and myself too. Never a dull moment, keeps our attention and is a very funny dude! He was able to bring to life so many ancient things, and make them have meaning today. I am taking him again if I can, I know he taeches Ethics. Take him, he's an amzinmg teacher.

I loved every minute of class. This was my 2nd class with him, and I'd take more if I could. Awesaome class, awesome lecture, awesome person! Funny that my first semester I had him for Philosophy (he made that great too), and Im graduating this semester, so I had him atthe beginning and end of my time at KSU. The Ethics class was hard, but worth it

He's a very approachable, open-minded, clever professor.  He knows what he's talking about and to make himself more appealing, he often tries to make jokes (sometimes too much). Just read, research online, go to class, and it's an easy A. Anyone who complains about the grade they received just didn't put in the work.

I absolutely loved him. He made me think about things I had just taken for granted, like beliefs. Now I have beliefs, but they are mine, not hand me downs (not "blind faith" as one of the readings called it "good faith").  He's very intelligent, knows the subject inside out,  respects the students. He is also very funny. I wanted to attend class!

Sure to give you a good laugh at some point in the semester and will also step on your toes. He really gets you to question your beliefs, and for me, it made me a lot stronger in what I already believe. If you like to read, take this class!!! He is very down to earth and all around great :)

He expects you to do the assigned readings and that's it. 3 thought papers, midterm, final. He's fairly straightforward and takes a holistic approach to grading in that he does into account your attendance (which he does not take everyday) and how much you interact with him. He wants a dialogue, not a monologue, so argue! Good teacher, better man

He is very helpful and obviously loves what he is teaching. He explains the sometimes complex readings in a way that anyone can understand. Definitely take notes on his lectures though. All assignments are papers or in class writing assignments. If you have read and understood how he explained it, you can't fail.
Awesome, all around! First year for Religious Studied and I an so glad I had him. All my friends raved about him and his class, and they were right!

He's funny but crude at times (expect adult themes), yet one of the smartest & honest Profs I've met! He said he isn't a "Biblical Scholar" but ripped the Bible thumpers at every turn (modest?), knows more about Religion than anyone. He's BRUTALLY HONEST, but nice. I want more classes with him, I loved him! No textbook, posted the readings for us.

Very funny professor. Great sense of humor. Lectures tend to get off topic and you will be there until the bell every day. Two exams and three thought papers. Attendance is mandatory but rarely checked. He doesn't make you buy a textbook which is awesome. Overall he's a funny guy, but exams are challenging. Wish he taught more of my classes.

Discussions in class are interesting. He has a good sense of humor and keeps his lessons engaging for the most part. Aside from not making us buy the book, this was the only thing I liked about the class. The tests are hard and there are only two of them. Essay/short answer format and he's really picky. He was late to class by 5+ mins every day.

Here's the thing....You don't even have to read the readings. Don't get me wrong, the readings are packed full of info. But he includes in his lectures what will undoubtedly be on the test. He's a funny guy and makes the class fun and intellectually stimulating. If you let him. His tests aren't hard if you realize that he likes lists.

Professor McMurrian is a funny dude that kept me engaged during lectures. However, he is a harsh grader on tests and papers and does all his  grading with letter grading so it's hard to know where you stand. I got a C because I didn't do all of the readings and tried to cram at the last minute. The lectures were helpful, but the material was dry.
Funny guy, keeps lectures entertaining. 3 papers and a midterm & final. The tests are extremely brutal. You have to read every reading, and take notes in class. Not an easy grader.

Professor McMurrain makes this subject a little easier to learn about. He rants a lot but claims that his rants have a purpose. Only a midterm, final, and 4 thought papers. Midterm and final are both essay tests. He is a great professor, but I just hated philosophy.

He is a funny teacher and makes philosophy a little more interesting to learn about. It's a pretty dry subject, but the class is not hard. As long as you actually read the book and listen to what he says, you should do fine. His tests kill me because they're essay, but it's really not as hard as I thought.
He is awesome, one of the best teacher's I've ever had. He opens your mind to the world and forces you to st out of your comfort zone, then he shows you how to make connections. He is also hilarious.

Excellent professor all-around that I highly recommend. He makes his class and material fun and easy to understand. As long as you project some of your own thoughts and feelings into your thought papers, you're good as gold.

I'm genuinely surprised at the amount of people that struggle in the class. Does 3 thought papers for 10% each (totaling 30%) which as long as you understand the assigned reading and can express yourself adequately are as easy of A's as they were for me. 10% participation grade, which includes randomized attendance, and 2 tests at 30% each. The tests are based off of assigned readings and are basically short comparative essays. I didn't struggle at all, though there were those that did.

Hes a good guy, but philosophy in general is hard. Readings are almost impossible to understand because they are from old authors but he does try to explain them in class. Very little work load but the Tests are hard. Yet he is not a very harsh grader. The papers are easy though. Id stay away from philosophy i u can.

One of his favorite movies is Monty Python, yeah, he's that type of guy. He has plenty of interesting things to say, but can often get side-tracked. Reading assignment (3 to 15 pgs IF that) due at every class with discussion. Tests are essay-based from selected readings (3 tests) + 3 "thought papers". Not too hard at all.

Had him for Ways of Knowing. Really laid back, easy going guy, get on tangents a lot. If you're even marginally a good college student you can get an A, just read (or pay attention during class) and midterm/final is pick 4 essays out of 6

Great. Approachable, funny/clever. 3 essays (30% total)attendance 10% and two exams 30% each make up ones grade. Lectures are very discussion based, read each entry and you should do fine. Tests are essay response. Fantastic teacher, I would recommend him to anyone.

I love this guy! He is hilarious and coming to class is so fun. He encourages everybody to discuss their opinions without making anyone feel insecure. Yes, you have to read a lot, but he assigns interesting readings and spends the entire next class discussing them and helping you understand them. He is a fair grader and wonderful person! Take him!

He's the best.. Will have u laughing the whole lecture.. Textbook will be used every day,so get it.. The readings are somewhat difficult to understand,but he breaks them down so that we can get them. I wish he taught other classes though... Mr.M is the best!! Def..take him if you can!!

Wonderful professor! He's incredibly helpful and very open to different opinions. He works very hard no to express his own opinions and encourages free thinking. Also, he's hilarious. Be prepared to read and think a lot. It's a good bit of work, but totally worth it.  You can make an A if you attend class and do the readings. Take him! He's a blast

Absolutely my favorite prof I've had. :) Definitely take him! He's WONDERFUL! Not to mention hilarious. Exams were a bit challenging, but this class is definitely worth the tiny bit of extra effort. I learned so much!
EXCELLENT!

GREAT prof.  This was my favorite class, and after it has been over for a month I still find myself missing it because of the discussions we would have and just some of the things that would happen in his class.  He is a great teacher, and really cares about his students and making a difference - a change in them. He inspires thinking and growth.

He's awesome! VERY funny and sarcastic. To get an A read what he assigns and answer the critical reading questions. He has 2 tests and picks questions from critical reading so if you answer them as you go it'll save you A LOT of time. Basically discuss in class and back up what you say and know what the philosophers believe.
I would highly recommend this class. He makes it very interesting and relatable. He is also hilarious and makes every class entertaining.

Awesome professor. Just a funny guy in general. Made the class really interesting so that you'd want to come to class. It wasn't all just about history and old guys, he made it relevant to today. Only two tests and three short papers. Just make sure you read!

I appreciated very much that he didn't talk about his own beliefs or opinions but strongly encouraged the class to openly and frankly express their own.  Grading was based on 3 relatively short papers and 2 essay exams. He takes attendance sporadically, but it is part of your grade, so come to class!  I would definitely take another of his classes.

awesome teacher! hes very laidback and fun. the subject isnt for me, but he made it interesting. the only issue i had was that he missed about 3 days w/o any notice, but i guess you cant really help that.
Great professor.

Very good professor -- excellent, best I've had at KSU. He made very old philosophers relevant to today and current events. He sparked controversy, but was respectful of differing opinions. His class actually helped me to make an argument, be better at forming my own, but that was what the class is all about (Critical Thinking) ... MOST EXCELLENT!
late to class everyday he missed class but took off points when if you missed class grading system

He's a good professor, and fun to talk to. Mispronounces words a lot, but that's about the worst thing I could say about him. There was a good bit of reading involved, but I liked the textbook, so it's ok. Grading is based on two tests and three papers.
Great lecturer, handsome, funny, smart, what's not to like?  Makes the material come to life,  I recommend him to everyone!

mc murrain was awesome, he was really smart and obviously loved the class. makes you work for your grade, and you have to come to class to understand the material but the lectures are so interesting you won't mind. great prof, i'd take him again. --he did miss class several times without warning though, that was annoying.
He rarely came to class and when he did, he was easily distracted from his material. Most material was not discussed in class. Make sure you read ALL of the readings, or your sure to get a bad grade!
McMurrain is sexy. takes attendance but misses a lot of classes. Grades people who can show that they actually read pretty easily. Just read and take notes.
Very good professor. Be ready to read a section of the book every night. Attendance is taken randomly. All together if you read you will do really well. 2 test all essay.

He is such an awesome guy. If you ask questions and participate in class, you will really enjoy it. Takes attendance more towards the end of the semester, but it doesn't change your grade that much. only 2 tests and 3 papers, but know your stuff and read notes he gives. very important!!
2 essay tests - one is 30% of your grade and the second 40% of your grade...Took attendace like every other class. He makes the class extremely interesting and knows his stuff.

There isn't enough room here for me to praise this prof. There's only 2 tests, and 2 papers. Attendance isn't required, but he'll randomly take it one or two times for extra credit. But it's his in-class attitude that made this class amazing, and worth taking. Funny, smart, and easily understood, do yourself a huge favor and sign up.
awesome guy!! loved this class! Very interesting and inspiring. only 2 papers and 2 test, all very easy! As long as you go to class and read the book :)

If you still haven't learned to think for yourself, stay away from this class.  Sure, reading the text helps, but he wants to hear what you think...if that's nothing, well...make something up!  He does a great job of keeping his own philosophical and religious beliefs to himself, letting you air yours freely, and making the class fun for everyone.
Awesome teacher. Very laid back and mostly a discussion class

He is awesome!  Funny in class and he really knows his stuff.  Makes the readings make sense, which is an accomplishment considering some of them are extremely abstract.  Tests are essay and there's only 2 in the class, but if you read and take notes and study, you'll get a good grade.

He is by far the best Prof I've ever had. He's very witty and made learning fun! If you read the assignments and discuss the next day in class you'll do fine. 3 Essay exams (hard). I would love to take him again (and again). I learned so much about philosophy & religion, myself, the world, etc.

AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME... i love this guy and his class. First teacher i've ever had at KSU that was this down to earth. Even perfers to be called by his first name. Class is fun and stimulating. I would take him again in a heart beat!
good guy, lots of fun in his class
Wendell is the man. If you show up for class and listen then you'll do fine. He is really really funny and relates his material well with neat examples. I would take him again in a heart beat.
This pro is awesome. Knows his stuff. Readings are abstract, so you need to get the hook up. Halla!!!

Very abstract class, reading pretty tough to understand.  However, he does a good job putting it in every day language.  Exams are abstract incorporating essay type interpretations or comparisons between Philosophical issues.

Professor McMurrain's class was truly a learning experience for me. Oh, and whoever that was that wrote "he looks like." He's cute! Santa still playing football ... Great teacher, very funny too! Not an easy A, but an easy B.

Dr. McMurrain was by far the best professor I've ever had. The readings were hard at times, but he explains everything in a way that everything made since. If you read & come to class its an easy A. Don't try to "BS" him though. He looks like a

I did not realize that a college course could be informative and fun -- but this one was both. He is demanding of the students, alot of reading, but I learned more about myself in the process. Class discussions were fun too (if you read)!

Whoever else rated him was right-this class is no fun unless you speak out aloud openly.If you don't he gets upset and goes around the room.He teaches the class like it is a major class,not just a core course.He expects you 2 know so much early on.
VERY good Instructor.  very frank and open in discussions.  must be able to comprehend philosophical reading and be able to discuss. class no fun if you do not participate.  GET THIS INSTRUCTOR!!!
